reviews.review: Despite its age, the gameplay of OpFor is still amazingly fun and fast-paced. The story has that familiar Half-Life flair despite it being produced by Gearbox. For multiplayer, there aren't many active servers anymore, but there are tons of custom maps (literally thousands) so the replay value is very large, especially if you're starting late in playing it (many years late). A classic, really.
Yes.

I consider this game better than the original Half-Life.

It has far better action and has some absolutely unforgettable and infinitely replayable setpiece moments, such as storming the Black Ops encampment within the train station with your fellow marines.

The level design, much like the original Half-Life's, is phenomenal. This has less jumping puzzles and irritating distractions from the core gameplay, which is definitely welcome. It is considerably more challenging, I should add; but in the right way.

My overall verdict is that this is one of the best FPSs ever made. I don't want to go on for too long, and my Half-Life review covers most aspects of this game. All I have to say is that this improves on the gameplay even more and ultimately surpasses the original Half-Life in fun value.
You want a decent Half-Life 1 game that's cheap? Get this.

There are some things you can never play enough. This is one of them.

Building on the already genre defining work of Half Life, Opposing Force is perhaps my favourite of HL1.
This expansion pack puts you in the jack-boots of cult favourite Adrian Shepard, and kits you up in a uniform that is all too familiar to the Freeman and Half Life players.
As one of the military spec ops. marines, you'll see the Black Mesa incident from an entirely new perspective. So even before you exam the gameplay, this is a brilliant piece for fleshing out the story.

But the gameplay is actually what makes OF work: It is, in my opinion, of a higher standard than the original game and introduces some fantastic ideas and elemants to the experiance. The player's arsenal increases exponentially, with a dismounted barnacle, electro-laser-xen gun, a teleportation device and the legendary SAW deserving special mention. You'll find no shortage of ways to splatter, maim and exact severe trauma on the interlopers of Xen !
The slightly dodgy squad system can be lived with and is very rarely a problem.

I recommend this with passion and zeal. A genuinely great piece of work that for me ticks more boxes than the Original Half Life.

This is for Half Life fans, story fanatics and for those who may be forgetting just why Half Life is the monolith to the gaming industry that it is.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is an awesome content extension in regards to the original Half-Life following a new character’s perspective going through new areas of Black Mesa dealing with new enemies, new weapons, and new bosses. Pretty fun, not that long but, not as short and shittty as Blue Shift. Worth getting if you like the original game.

+Lots of new environmental dangers and new rope climbing physics

-Multiplayer is dead af as you can expect for a 20+ game. No real point of even trying to play as the majority of the servers are empty and usually only have 5 people or less online at once only for them to all be in a private server or in a server with bots and you can’t tell the difference between the 2.
-Game has the same mouse glitch as Blue Shift where it keeps locking to a fixated position again and again. Enabling input mouse raw some shit idk fixes this.
-The initial room in the observation deck with the giant green claw alien where you have to use the barnacle weapon to traverse into an elevated room was without a doubt so annoying. The game never explains or seems as if to show you that you can latch onto green glowing balls on the wall with the barnacle leaving you confused on what to do. 
-Remote play? I don’t understand how all the original Half-Life games have a remote play option when there is no split screen whatsoever. Shit ain’t gonna work.

I recommend this brilliant game. 

Play as Adrian Shepard a soldier/grunt sent on a mission to Black Mesa. All goes terribly wrong as the Xen army begin teleporting in and outside the research facility, forcing Shepard and his team down.

Shepard must gain help from fellow militia and on-site scientists and guards if he wants to survive as he pursues his target of capturing the rogue psychicist Gordon Freeman.

Being quite a lot longer than Blue Shift(had I not speedrun it), this delivers some more insight about the mission of the military at Black Mesa. It was pretty good but I personally think it is the weakest out of the three (Half Life 1 the main game, Blue Shift and this). Still worth playing.

In Opposing Force you play as Adrian Shepard , You will instantly notice that your the soldier that was betrayed along with other to dispose in the Black Mesa Research Facility , You serve a diffrent role as now you were the enemy of the Half Life infamous Gordon Freeman . a U.S. Marine Corporal to kill all witnesses and eliminiate the alien threat , but what happens when your government betrays you.
As for gameplay it introduces new guns which are exciting and the plain thought of playing as the enemy excits me as it is a concept barly exist in videogames. 
The story is quite fun but the last boss is just a shame repeating the same proccess is too boring but all other levels are quite good and live up to half life standards. 
I would recommend this over Blue Shift which I think should be skipped on and just play opposing forces a better storyline , gameplay and an overall expirence.

This non-inventive game is actually a solid game if you remind yourself you are playing a very linear , half-life based level pack.The levels are a hodge-podge of black-mesa areas / zones. Most fights take place in corridor/small-medium rooms, so keep that shotgun hotkeyed. Mostly you fight aliens, as you are a marine this time around. The enemy is exactly as the alien enemy was in half-life plus a few new baddies (that were borring but not detrimental to the fun). 

  The level design is linear, but made intereting by having elegantly masked  the progression path with enviornmental puzzles. These puzzles involve shooting explosives to break open a new path, and/or moving crates to reach vents and other areas. The puzzles are rarely stumping/frusterating, yet their sollution gives the illusion of cleverness, which is a satisfying addition to the bad-ass feeling you get from the combat. 

  Music is used very occasionally, often to signify an event that lacks the momentum the sudden and intense music clips would have you expecting. The rest of the sounds are exactly the same as half-life 1. Again this is a half-life level pack, not a sequel or prequel.

  As far as story, you're one of the nameless marine grunts gordon kills. Thinks get fubar quick, and pretty soon your alone in black-mesa rushing to meet the evacuating remains of the marines. The story is dictated through the occasional human npcs. The dialogue makes references to the half-life universe and games without really adding to the half-life plot itself. This game can be skipped from the canonical half-life series if you only care about the story.
  
  Its worth the time if you remind yourself to expect a solid level pack , it's just a seamless collection of worth-while (and occasionally excellent) half-life levels.

Na ilyennek kell egy kiegészítőnek lennie! 
A Half-Life sztoriját ezúttal egy HECU katona szemszögéből láthatjuk, ráadásul igen hamar az elszabadult pokol kellős közepén találhatjuk magunkat, nincs már olyan hosszú felvezetés, mint az alapjátéknál. A történet néhány helyen keresztezi az alap-HL-t, de egyébként teljesen eredeti sztoriról van szó, a pályák nagy része is teljesen új, a Black Mesa eddig nem látott területeire visznek el.
Talán a katona karakter miatt a játékmenet sokkal akciódúsabb, bár néhány logikai feladvány azért itt is helyet kapott. Fegyverek tekintetében elég sok újdonság bemutatkozik, ezek egyike-másika igen kreatív, nem csak valami random új halálosztó szerszám. Mivel a karakterünk a HECU tagja, így velük szerencsére ezúttal nem kell megküzdeni, sőt, lehetőségünk van nekik parancsokat osztogatni, így bizonyos pontokon kész kis hadsereggel rohangálhatunk. Természetesen a kiesett HECU helyére érkeztek új ellenfelek, de róluk inkább nem szólnék, derüljön ki a játék során kik vagy mik ők.
A Half-Life kedvelőinek mindenképp ajánlom ezt a játékot, de azoknak is érdemes kipróbálni, akik az akciódús FPS-eket szeretik, ezért aztán elriasztotta őket esetleg a többször logikára építő HL.

In this expansion of Half-Life You play as one of the soldiers that originally tried to kill you in Half-Life. I will keep it short and sweet, there are new weapons as well as new monsters. 

The game is slightly harder than the first Half-Life in terms of enemies being stronger, and puzzles being a bit harder. The wonderful thing is you get a selection of new weapons. You get a sniper rifle which is very useful against enemies at a distance. You also get an m249 saw so you can go Rambo on those headcrabs and  roof barnicles, speaking of barnicles guess what? You actually get the barnicle as a weapon, you can use its unlogically long tongue to tarzan swing from catwalk to catlwalk or you can latch onto monsters and let the barnicle eat them. Kind of neat...and nast at the same time!!! ^_^ 

Overall this is another amazing classic that you should deffinitly pick up.

If you oppose Opposing Force, I will force Opposing Force up yo ass and the opposing orifice using the Force.

Opposing Force definitely lives up to its name, not only do you get to play as your enemies from Half-Life, but there's also tons and tons of combat! That's not a bad thing either, most of Half-Life was puzzle solving and platforming whereas this is more along the lines of heavy duty survival and combat. The later levels manage to get especially nasty while still finding a nice balance between tactical but still fun.

 The new weapon ideas that OF offered were hit and miss though, the SAW & Desert Eagle are neat additions whereas the alien guns were iffy and largely boring. Similarly, the barnacle grappling system and the squad system really should've been more refined, they were awesome when they worked right...sadly that just wasn't too often. Although, the new aliens definitely rounded out for a altogether fresh experience, I especially liked how the story that tied into the original so well while avoiding being a total retread. A must play for any fan of Half-Life.

Here's to Shepard returning for Half-Life 3!
An excellent expansion to Half-Life, better than the original in some parts (certainly in the weapon selection.) Don't you miss the time when games got expansions instead of DLC?

HF: Opposing Force - как по мне, самое известное и интересное дополнение для Half Life. Оно предоставляет игроку тот же сеттинг, что и оригинал, с той лишь разницой что игрок берёт под своё управление капрала Адриана Шепарда, солдата спецподразделения HECU. Так же в игре есть сетевая игра, зайдя в которую можно увидить парочку олдфагов которые катают на полумёртвых серверах.

Opposing Force was really great. It was considerably longer than Blue Shift, and focused a lot more on puzzle mechanics and figuring out where to go next. Controlling a few squads of npcs was also a bonus, as well as some new weapons you could pick up along the way. Definitely something worth playing if you've already played Half-Life.
Better of the two add ons for the original half life. adds in new weapons,enemies,etc.
The great expantion to the original Half Life, add new stuff like new weps and enemes like the new Race X aliens and now the HECU marines are your allies.

God, I love this game. Not only does it have new weapons and enemies, which is something Blue Shift lacks, but it also goes in depth into some unexplained parts of the story, such as what happens to Black Mesa and why the Black Operatives are there. What a nice twist to the story. It also has free multiplayer. As of this review, I'm currently playing it through a third time, and have yet to get tired of it. I definitely like it better than Half Life.

One awesome expansion pack for Half Life, letting you play in the boots of a USMC Marine. Thankfully, you never meet Gordon in-game, or he'd carve you a new haircut, Kurt Cobain style. Gameplay is made much more fun, thanks to the addition of several new weapons, including a portable Barnacle to be used as grappling gun, and a living Grenade Launcher. You may also be in command of a team, and give your otherwise-not-so-bright teammates some basic orders.

This is an awesome continuation of Half Life. The puzzles seem to be a little bit more harder but how the story directly involves Freeman and the other side of the story is fitting and great to play.
VER NICE!

Revive la aventura por toda Black Mesa desde el bando de los soldados HECU metiéndote en la piel del cabo Adrian Shepard. Tu misión consiste en buscar y capurar a Gordon Freeman, aquel que desde "Enemigos a la vista" hasta "Olvídate de Freeman" en Half-Life (excluyendo el "Foso explosivo") ha ido eliminando a cada uno de tus nuevos compañeros de este juego.
пожалуй, самое популярное дополнение к первой Half-Life, много новых врагов и оружия, позволяет взглянуть на события в Черной Мезе со стороны одного из солдат, капрала Шепарда

The original Half Life offers the perfect FPS balance between simple killing, found in titles such as DOOM and Painkiller, and a sense of realism and imersion found in more recent offerings such as the Modern Warfare series. What Opposing Force does is to add to the original with a plethera of new weapons, enemies and settings. If you want to play a game which utilises and improves on the legendary Half Life, this is for you.

Excellent spin-off to the original Half Life story. What would it be like to see the story from an enemy soldier's point of view? OpFor answers that question, and answers it well. Gameplay is slightly longer than the original Half Life. 9/10
A lot more action-oriented than the original Half-Life, Opposing Force also adds plenty of new enemies weapons. Plus, it was developed by Gearbox, who you might know from Borderlands fame.

작중에 등장하는 특수부대원 중 한명으로 고든과는 또다른 장소에서 제 역할을 하는 인물.
